intro: Amyrea humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's amyrea, is a rare and little-known plant species native to specific regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and related flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and produces fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Amyrea humbertii is considered a species of conservation concern.
